entries.title: Hibernian 0-4 Celtic: Scottish Premiership leaders win 12th straight match
entries.description: Celtic will go into next week's "showcase" Glasgow derby on a run of 12 straight Scottish Premiership wins after thumping Hibernian at Easter Road.

entries.title: Energy giant ExxonMobil sues EU to block energy windfall tax
entries.description: The US company says the levy on its profits will discourage future investment in Europe.

entries.title: Rangers 3-0 Motherwell: Ibrox side keep up run going into Old Firm derby
entries.description: Revitalised Rangers maintain Michael Beale's 100% start going into the Old Firm derby as Motherwell's worrying run in the Scottish Premiership continues.

entries.title: Leeds 1-3 Man City: Erling Haaland reaches 20 Premier League goals in record time
entries.description: Erling Haaland becomes the fastest player to reach 20 Premier League goals in a season as Manchester City overcome a stubborn Leeds to reduce Arsenal's lead at the top of the table to five points.

entries.title: Cody Gakpo: New Liverpool arrival's 2022 World Cup goals for Netherlands
entries.description: Watch Cody Gakpo's goals for the Netherlands at the 2022 World Cup, as Liverpool reach agreement to sign the striker from PSV Eindhoven.

entries.title: Cody Gakpo: Liverpool reach agreement with PSV Eindhoven to sign forward
entries.description: Liverpool reach an agreement to sign Netherlands forward Cody Gakpo from Dutch club PSV Eindhoven.

entries.title: Strep A: Woman arrested after girl, 8, dies in Lampeter
entries.description: Health officials investigate possible Step A links to child's death, as police inquiry continues.

entries.title: Covid in China: Countries tighten rules as tourism set to resume
entries.description: China is opening its borders after three years - but as Covid cases surge, other countries are wary.

entries.title: 2022 will be warmest year ever for UK, Met Office says
entries.description: Provisional figures suggest this year's average temperature will beat the all-time high set in 2014.

entries.title: US winter storm death toll rises as bad weather drags on
entries.description: Clean-up is underway in Erie County, which was one of the hardest hit regions in the US.

entries.title: Fatal car crash involving over 200 vehicles in China
entries.description: At least one person has been killed after heavy fog caused a pile-up near the city of Zhengzhou.

entries.title: Wallasey pub murder: Police say they will not rest in pub killer hunt
entries.description: The shooting of Elle Edwards, 26, was "the most appalling and callous murder", a detective says.

entries.title: James Maddison: Leicester midfielder sees knee specialist
entries.description: Leicester's James Maddison sees a specialist about his knee injury and is ruled out of Friday's Premier League match against Liverpool at Anfield.

entries.title: Reece James: Chelsea and England defender out for up to four weeks with knee injury
entries.description: Chelsea defender Reece James is set to miss three to four weeks with a knee injury suffered during Tuesday's 2-0 Premier League win over Bournemouth.

entries.title: Two children in Scotland die with Strep A infection
entries.description: Public Health Scotland confirms two children under the age of 10 have died since October.

entries.title: Wembley Stadium: FA backs plans for new fences to help curb disorder
entries.description: The application follows a report by Baroness Casey which looked at disorder before the Euro 2020 final.

entries.title: Leah Williamson: England captain says Endometriosis led to Euros fears
entries.description: Captain Leah Williamson admits she feared missing games during England's successful Euro 2022 campaign because of her endometriosis.

entries.title: John Bird: Actor and comedian dies aged 86
entries.description: The Bafta-winning actor was best known for political satire, including Bremner, Bird and Fortune.

entries.title: Fight! Peruvians settle scores at annual festival
entries.description: An annual event in Peru aimed at settling old issues for the new year involves people fighting to music.

entries.title: NBA: Luka Doncic scores 60-point triple double as Dallas Mavericks beat New York Knicks
entries.description: Watch highlights of Luka Doncic's historic first 60-point 'triple-double' in NBA history, as he helps the Dallas Mavericks earn a 126-121 overtime win over the New York Knicks.

entries.title: Cody Fisher: Murder arrests over Birmingham nightclub stabbing
entries.description: Cody Fisher was fatally injured while on a night out in Birmingham on Boxing Day.

entries.title: Speedo Mick set to start final fundraising walk
entries.description: Michael Cullen will walk from John O'Groats to Land's End before finally hanging up his trunks.

entries.title: Pope Francis says predecessor Benedict is very ill
entries.description: The Vatican says the ex-Pope's condition has worsened and Pope Francis asks pilgrims to pray.

entries.title: Hong Kong to scrap almost all its Covid rules
entries.description: The Chinese city once had some of the toughest restrictions in the world, but is now opening up.

entries.title: UK weather extremes to become 'new normal', says National Trust
entries.description: The National Trust says this year's weather is a stark illustration of the challenges facing nature.

entries.title: Dog rescued on Christmas Day from Utah mountains
entries.description: Nala was separated from her owner after a Christmas Eve hike in the mountains.

entries.title: China Covid: US considers restrictions on Chinese arrivals
entries.description: Japan and India have already announced tighter measures as China finally reopens its borders.

entries.title: Russian troops able to freeze sperm for free - lawyer
entries.description: When Russia called up 300,000 reservists for Ukraine, men asked clinics to freeze their sperm.

entries.title: Chris Mason: Images of extraordinary year in UK politics
entries.description: The BBC's political editor looks back at some of the moments away from the photo-op in a dramatic year at Westminster.

entries.title: Air Balloon: Landmark pub to close forever on New Year's Eve
entries.description: The Air Balloon in Birdlip is being demolished to make way for a major road upgrade on the A417.

entries.title: Bristol's van dwellers suffer as cost of living bites
entries.description: The low-cost way of life is not immune to the rising cost of items like fuel and food.

entries.title: Wales weather: Flood risk as heavy rain hits
entries.description: Heavy rain prompts alerts for flooding across Wales.

entries.title: Enid Bakewell: Meet England legend touring Australia in her 80s
entries.description: England World Cup winner Enid Bakewell is aged 82 and tells BBC Sport about spending part of her winter playing cricket in Australia.

entries.title: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe: Watching Andy Murray from prison was joyful
entries.description: The former detainee tells the Wimbledon champion how she watched the match from an Iranian prison.

entries.title: British woman Emma Lovell killed in Australia during break-in
entries.description: Two boys, aged 17, are charged with Emma Lovell's murder, according to Queensland police.

entries.title: Australia v South Africa: Alex Carey century keeps hosts in charge in Melbourne
entries.description: Wicketkeeper Alex Carey scores a maiden century as Australia keep pushing for a series-sealing victory over South Africa in Melbourne.

entries.title: Michael O'Neill: What's on NI manager's 'to-do' list as he returns for second spell?
entries.description: As Michael O'Neill starts his second spell as Northern Ireland manager, BBC Sport examines what might be in his in-tray.

entries.title: Tennis in 2023: What can Rafael Nadal, Novak Djokovic & Emma Raducanu expect?
entries.description: Before the new season starts, we consider the big tennis questions for 2023 and correspondent Russell Fuller gives his verdict.

entries.title: Irish state papers: Ahern rejected Trimble's Irish arms inquiry request
entries.description: Irish state papers from 1997 and 1998 detail the Republic of Ireland's arms crisis in the 1970s.

entries.title: Four injured in Evesham suspected gas explosion
entries.description: Properties are evacuated and four people treated in hospital after the incident in Evesham.

entries.title: Missing girl, 13, found safe after Christmas disappearance
entries.description: Lyla Lake, who was missing for almost a week over Christmas, has been found safe, police say.

entries.title: Afghanistan Taliban: 'I wish God had never created women'
entries.description: An Afghan teenager says animals have more freedom than women under Taliban rule.

entries.title: Children's social work agency spending soars, research suggests
entries.description: Council bosses in England fear the 38% spending rise on agency staff since 2017 will harm services.

entries.title: From Batgirl to Wagatha: 15 flops and blunders in culture in 2022
entries.description: From Wagatha Christie to Batgirl, these moments were some of the year's most unfortunate.

entries.title: ‘I went through the menopause before my mum did’
entries.description: Dealing with menopause wasn't how Emma, Soe-Myat and Elspeth had imagined their 20s.

entries.title: Cost of living: Deliveroo and Uber couriers face uphill struggle
entries.description: Gig economy workers say they're having to make changes as orders drop and their wages stagnate.

entries.title: Heated clothes airer vs tumble dryer: What's cheaper?
entries.description: If you're tempted to buy a heated airer, then watch this. We investigate whether it's worth it.

entries.title: Jasmine Harrison reflects on record-breaking 2022 UK swim
entries.description: Jasmine Harrison, 23, explains what it was like to spend three months swimming the length of the UK.

entries.title: What women on minimum wage gave up in 2022
entries.description: The cost of living crisis has hit people on low wages hard - here's what some have given up this year.

entries.title: UN Security Council urges Taliban to reverse restrictions on women
entries.description: The Taliban have recently banned women from attending university and working for NGOs.

entries.title: The Senegal man on a mission to plant five million trees
entries.description: Adama Diémé was motivated after seeing once-verdant villages in Senegal without a single tree.

entries.title: Strikes: Border Force, rail and driving test staff walk out
entries.description: About 1,000 workers at six UK airports will resume their walkout over pay and conditions.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Civilians flee Kherson as Russian attacks intensify
entries.description: The Ukrainian city, liberated from Russian control last month, is coming under heavy bombardment.

entries.title: 'Marcus Rashford impressing but Manchester United still need a striker'
entries.description: In-form Marcus Rashford is scoring goals for Manchester United, but Alan Shearer and Michael Owen explain why the club should still buy a striker.

entries.title: The Papers: 'Strikes to escalate' and 'toxic' Sandhurst culture
entries.description: Looming strikes and sexual assault claims at the Sandhurst military academy lead the papers.
